channel.title: Cambodia on Nathan Lane
channel.description: Recent content in Cambodia on Nathan Lane

item.title: Political Economy and Rock n' Roll in Pre-Pol Pot Cambodia
item.description: (A respite from data- - ) In the 1960s and 70s Cambodia was home an emergent rock scene, inspired by Western rock that was rolling its way into the region. The rise of the Khmer Rouge put a swift end to a subversive subculture. As in the clips below, youth culture isn't quite compatible with authoritarianism...much less a utopian regime attempting a hard reboot of society to "year zero."
